Key Match Events: Lebanon and China PR settled for a 0-0 draw
Lebanon's Khalil Khamsi saw his header from Kassem El Zein's throw-in collected safely by goalkeeper Yan Junling
Lui Bin Bin's effort was punched away by Lebanese custodian Mostafa Matar
Omar Chaban's right-footed attempt hitting the side netting
Dai Weijun forced Matar into action
Hasan Matouk’s right footed shot from outside the box was denied by the crossbar
Zhang Linpeng’s header from the centre of the box had to be parried away
Hasan Srour’s right-footed shot from outside the box was fisted away by Junling
Srour denied Wu Lei's shot from inside the six yard box
Pre-Game Insights: Lebanon were the quicker to settle and they took the game to a China side who looked shaky each time they came under pressure
Post-Match Reflections: The result took China PR to two points while it was Lebanon’s first with both teams having much to do on Matchday Three if they are to advance to the Round of 16
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Al Thumama Stadium
The West Asians survived a similar scare soon after when Srour denied Wu Lei's shot from inside the six yard box
Others: China will face hosts Qatar on Monday while Lebanon will cross swords with debutants Tajikistan
